title: Function reference
text:
Introduction to the package.



Functions to inspect docstrings.



aj

title: Get started with polarstate
text:
import polars as pl
from polarstate.aj import aalen_johansen


Get starteds with polarstate

lifelinespolarstate



from lifelines import AalenJohansenFitter
from lifelines.datasets import load_waltons
T, E = load_waltons()['T'], load_waltons()['E']
ajf = AalenJohansenFitter(calculate_variance=True)
ajf.fit(T, E, event_of_interest=1)
ajf.cumulative_density_

from lifelines import AalenJohansenFitter
from lifelines.datasets import load_waltons
from polarstate.aj import *


T, E = load_waltons()['T'], load_waltons()['E']

times_and_reals = pl.DataFrame({
        "times": T,
        "reals": E
    })

times_and_counts = group_reals_by_times(times_and_reals)
events_data = add_events_at_times_column(times_and_counts)
events_data = add_at_risk_column(events_data)
events_data = add_cause_specific_hazards_columns(events_data)
events_data = add_overall_survival_column(events_data)
events_data = add_previous_overal_survival_column(events_data)
events_data = add_transition_probabilities_at_times_columns(events_data)
result = add_state_occupancy_probabilities_at_times_columns(events_data)




print(result)

shape: (32, 15)
┌───────┬─────────┬─────────┬─────────┬───┬──────────────┬─────────────┬─────────────┬─────────────┐
│ times ┆ count_0 ┆ count_1 ┆ count_2 ┆ … ┆ trainsition_ ┆ trainsition ┆ state_occup ┆ state_occup │
│ ---   ┆ ---     ┆ ---     ┆ ---     ┆   ┆ probabilitie ┆ _probabilit ┆ ancy_probab ┆ ancy_probab │
│ f64   ┆ i64     ┆ i64     ┆ i64     ┆   ┆ s_to_1…      ┆ ies_to_2…   ┆ ility_1_…   ┆ ility_2_…   │
│       ┆         ┆         ┆         ┆   ┆ ---          ┆ ---         ┆ ---         ┆ ---         │
│       ┆         ┆         ┆         ┆   ┆ f64          ┆ f64         ┆ f64         ┆ f64         │

│ 9.0   ┆ 0       ┆ 3       ┆ 0       ┆ … ┆ 0.01852      ┆ 0.0         ┆ 0.03079     ┆ 0.0         │
│ 13.0  ┆ 0       ┆ 3       ┆ 0       ┆ … ┆ 0.01852      ┆ 0.0         ┆ 0.04931     ┆ 0.0         │
│ 15.0  ┆ 0       ┆ 2       ┆ 0       ┆ … ┆ 0.012347     ┆ 0.0         ┆ 0.061656    ┆ 0.0         │
│ …     ┆ …       ┆ …       ┆ …       ┆ … ┆ …            ┆ …           ┆ …           ┆ …           │
│ 63.0  ┆ 0       ┆ 9       ┆ 0       ┆ … ┆ 0.06023      ┆ 0.0         ┆ 0.81931     ┆ 0.0         │

Polarstate

times = pl.Series([1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
reals = pl.Series([1, 0, 2, 1, 0])

result = aalen_johansen(times, reals)



print(result)

shape: (3, 2)
┌──────┬────────┐
│ time ┆ cuminc │
│ ---  ┆ ---    │
│ i64  ┆ f64    │
╞══════╪════════╡
│ 1    ┆ 0.2    │
│ 3    ┆ 0.2    │
│ 4    ┆ 0.7    │
└──────┴────────┘

title: aj
text:
aj





Name
Description




aalen_johansen
Compute the Aalen-Johansen estimator for cumulative incidence in the presence of competing risks.


group_reals_by_times
Count occurrences of each event type (0, 1, 2) per unique observed time.


add_events_at_times_column



add_at_risk_column
Add a column to the DataFrame that counts the number of individuals at risk at each time point.


add_cause_specific_hazards_columns
Add columns for cause-specific hazards and conditional survival at each time point.


add_overall_survival_column
Add a column for overall survival, defined as the cumulative product of





aj.aalen_johansen(times, reals, event_of_interest=1, competing_events=None)
Compute the Aalen-Johansen estimator for cumulative incidence in the presence of competing risks.











Name
Type
Description
Default




times
pl.Series
Event or censoring times for each observation.
required


reals
pl.Series
Event type for each observation (0 for censored, event codes otherwise).
required


event_of_interest
int
The event code for the event of interest (default is 1).
1


competing_events
list of int
List of event codes considered as competing events. If None, defaults to [2].
None














Name
Type
Description





pl.DataFrame
DataFrame with columns: - ‘time’: unique event times - ‘cuminc’: cumulative incidence estimate at each time






This implementation assumes that event codes are integers, with 0 indicating censoring.




aj.group_reals_by_times(df)
Count occurrences of each event type (0, 1, 2) per unique observed time.











Name
Type
Description
Default




df
pl.DataFrame
A Polars DataFrame with at least two columns: - ‘times’ (int): The observed time for each record. - ‘reals’ (int): The event type for each record, where: - 0 indicates censoring, - 1 indicates the primary event, - 2 indicates a competing event.
required














Name
Type
Description





pl.DataFrame
A DataFrame with one row per unique time and three additional columns: - ‘count_0’: Number of censored observations at that time. - ‘count_1’: Number of primary events at that time. - ‘count_2’: Number of competing events at that time.







Input is assumed to be clean (i.e., times and reals are properly typed).
Times are sorted in ascending order in the output.
If a particular event type does not occur at a time, its count will be 0.





aj.add_events_at_times_column(sorted_times_and_reals)



aj.add_at_risk_column(events_data)
Add a column to the DataFrame that counts the number of individuals at risk at each time point.











Name
Type
Description
Default




events_data
pl.DataFrame
A DataFrame with columns ‘times’, ‘count_0’, ‘count_1’, and ‘count_2’.
required














Name
Type
Description





pl.DataFrame
The input DataFrame with an additional column ‘at_risk’ that contains the number of individuals at risk at each time point.







aj.add_cause_specific_hazards_columns(events_data)
Add columns for cause-specific hazards and conditional survival at each time point.











Name
Type
Description
Default




events_data
pl.DataFrame
A DataFrame with columns: - ‘count_0’: number of censored individuals at each time point, - ‘count_1’: number of primary events at each time point, - ‘count_2’: number of competing events at each time point, - ‘at_risk’: number of individuals at risk at each time point.
required














Name
Type
Description





pl.DataFrame
The input DataFrame with three additional columns: - ‘csh_1’: cause-specific hazard for event type 1 (count_1 / at_risk) - ‘csh_2’: cause-specific hazard for event type 2 (count_2 / at_risk) - ‘conditional_survival’: probability of not having any event at that time (count_0 / at_risk)







aj.add_overall_survival_column(events_data)
Add a column for overall survival, defined as the cumulative product of the conditional survival probabilities up to and including each time point.











Name
Type
Description
Default




events_data
pl.DataFrame
A Polars DataFrame with a column ‘conditional_survival’ representing the probability of surviving past each time point.
required














Name
Type
Description





pl.DataFrame
The input DataFrame with an additional column ‘overall_survival’, which contains the Kaplan-Meier-style survival probability at each time.
